Key Match Events: Georges Mikautadze scored from the penalty spot to register his second goal of the tournament.
Patrik Schick equalised with his chest for the Czech Republic after Ondrej Lingr’s header cannoned against a post.
Saba Lobzhanidze missed a crucial chance to clinch victory for Georgia with the last kick of the game.
Giorgi Mamardashvili made 11 saves and was named man of the match.
Post-Match Reflections: Willy Sagnol, the Georgia manager, expressed mixed feelings after the match, acknowledging the disappointment of missing a win but celebrating Georgia's first point at a European Championship.
Ivan Hasek, the Czech head coach, reflected on the game, noting the high number of shots and the near loss despite dominating the game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at Volksparkstadion Hamburg.
This was Georgia's first European Championship.
